CatDescriptText: Miss Viola Thomas, secretary for Germo-Sanitary Co., 2162 Wylie Avenue, 2508 Wylie Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 29, 1959, pg. A1 with question: Do you believe the state and city FEPC laws are helping Negroes to get jobs they never held before?" answer reads: "Because of my vocation, I have had numerous occasions to acquaint me more thoroughly with this situation. I think these laws have helped a great deal, in comparison to a few years ago.  However, I feel that there is still room for a considerable amount of improvement.  These laws are not one-half effective as they should be."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Viola Thomas wearing striped sleeveless blouse and earrings, posed behind desk in office of Germo-Sanitary Co., 2162 Wylie Avenue, Hill District
